titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Guide to the Emma Joy Dana Collection of Anna Mackova
Dana (Emma Joy) Collection of Anna Mackova
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Jae Rossman and Alexis Knowlton

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Monday April 22, 2019 at 23:00

did.unittitle: Emma Joy Dana collection of Anna Mackova
did.abstract: The collection documents the graphic design career of Anna Macková.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Emma Joy Dana Collection of Anna Macková, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Anna Macková (1887-1969) worked in Czechoslovakia in the early to mid 20th century. After art school, Macková took commissions and made print and bookplate portfolios. Her work was early on influenced by traditional folk art designs and art nouveau. Over the years, Macková developed her own distinctive and more naturalistic style. She skillfully depicted animals, flowers, and landscape scenes. Macková had a longtime romantic relationship with artist Josef Vachal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection documents the graphic design career of Anna Macková. It consists of biographical materials, including some clippings and exhibition pamphlets collected by Macková herself, as well as a variety of graphic works, drawing and paintings, and decorative boxes by Macková. The collection also includes a selection of prints by other artists, including a portrait of Macková by J. Vachal.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into six series: I. Biographical Materials. II. Illustrated Books. III. Boxes. IV. Drawings and Paintings. V. Prints. VI. Ex-Libris. Within each series, materials are arranged chronologically.
The designation "VRT" indicates vertical file storage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This section contains clippings and exhibition pamphlets, some collected by Macková.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Macková created decorative boxes to hold small prints, drawings, and ex-libris. The boxes also contained loose prints and ex-libris which are in Series V. Prints and Series VI. Ex-Libris. The works have been separated from the boxes for preservation reasons.

did.unittitle: From box with landscape scene on front cover
From box with patchwork image cover

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This section contains examples of painting and drawing by Macková.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This section contains individual prints and portfolios. Untitled works are given a descriptive title in brackets. See also Series III. Boxes and Series VI. Ex-Libris for other printed materials.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Includes a portrait of Macková by J. Vachal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This section contains both ex-libris portfolios as well as individual bookplates.
